title: Fish tacos
description: I am a broad church: when I’m not craving a bowl of food that delivers the same soothing taste from mouthful to mouthful, I like the sort of meal that involves a table full of bits and pieces. I certainly think this latter way of eating is one of the most relaxing ways of sitting around a table with friends. These fish tacos are a case in point, and rest assured that the actual preparation is much more low-effort than you might think.
ingredients: 1 small red onion, peeled, halved and sliced into half moons
2 tsp gochujang paste, or other hot sauce, to taste
1 fresh red chilli, finely diced (de-seed if you don’t like too much heat)
4 skinless fillets of firm white fish, such as hake or haddock (750–900g/1lb10oz-2lb total), from the thicker loin end
1 garlic clove, peeled and finely grated or minced
